snippet: Chevron said net income fell 6 percent in the third quarter as weak refining results and higher operating costs offset higher oil and gas production and prices.
abstract: Chevron says net income has fallen 6 percent in the third quarter as weak refining results and higher operating costs offset higher oil and gas production and prices; posts earnings of $4.95 billion on revenue of $56.6 billion, down from $5.25 billion income on revenue of $55.66 billion in year-ago period.
lead_paragraph: Chevron said net income fell 6 percent in the third quarter as weak refining results and higher operating costs offset higher oil and gas production and prices.

headline.main: Chevron Earnings Sag on Poor Refining Results
headline.print_headline: Chevron Earnings Sag On Poor Refining Results
